Sentencas: The interactions and reduction mechanisms of O-2 molecule on the fully oxidized and reduced CeO2 surface were studied using periodic density functional theory calculations implementing on-site Coulomb interactions (DFT + U) consideration.
Titulo: Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study

Sentencas: The adsorbed O-2 species on the oxidized CeO2 surface were characterized by physisorption.
Titulo: Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study

Sentencas: Their adsorption energies and vibrational frequencies are within -0.05 to 0.02 eV and 1530-1552 cm(-1) respectively.
Titulo: Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study

Sentencas: For the reduced CeO2 surface, the adsorption of O-2 on Ce4+, one-electron defects (Ce3+ on the CeO2 surface) and two-electron defects (neutral oxygen vacancy) can alter geometrical parameters and results in the formation of surface physisorbed O-2, O-2(a-) (0 < a < 1), superoxide (O-2(-)), and peroxide (O-2(2-)) species.
Titulo: Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study

Sentencas: Their corresponding adsorption energies are -0.01 to -0.09, -0.20 to -0.37, -1.34 and -1.86 eV, respectively.
Titulo: Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study

Sentencas: The predicted vibrational frequencies of the peroxide, superoxide, O-2(a-) (0 < a < 1) and physisorbed species are 897, 1234, 1323-1389, and 1462-1545 cm(-1), respectively, which are in good agreement with experimental data.
Titulo: Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study

Sentencas: Potential energy profiles for the O-2 reduction on the oxidized and reduced CeO2 (111) surface were constructed using the nudged elastic band method.
Titulo: Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study

Sentencas: Our calculations show that the reduced surface is energetically more favorable than the unreduced surface for oxygen reduction.
Titulo: Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study

Sentencas: In addition, we have studied the oxygen ion diffusion process on the surface and in bulk ceria.
Titulo: Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study

Sentencas: The small barrier for the oxygen ion diffusion through the subsurface and bulk implies that ceria-based oxides are high ionic conductivity at relatively low temperatures which can be suitable for IT-SOFC electrolyte materials.
Titulo: Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study
Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study

Sentencas: Wiley Periodicals, Inc. J Comput Chem 30: 2433-2442, 2009
Titulo: Identifying the O2 Diffusion and Reduction Mechanisms on CeO2 Electrolyte in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells: A DFT plus U Study
